intro: Hovea apiculata, commonly known as the silky hovea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces showy yellow flowers. Hovea apiculata is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
